content.raw:
I was a little confused by the meaning of adjacent, given the documentation I'd expect that to include both incoming and outgoing vertexes. But looking at the tests the code is only returning the outgoing ones.

So I took a 2 min [crash course](http://www.slideshare.net/Abrish06/graph-48747573) on graph theory sponsored by google and my current understanding is:

![graph.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/dg5enz/images/1250468184-graph.png)

* vertex 0 is adjacent **to** 1
* vertex 1 is adjacent **from** 0
* vertex 0 is adjacent (to + from) 1 and 3
* edge (0->1) is incident **to** vertex 1
* edge (0->1) is incident **from** vertex 0
* edge (0->1) is incident (to + from) vertexes 0 and 1
